Description: Papyrus, labelled frame E. Frame A has label 'The sheets A to F belonged to a 'made up' roll of papyrus relaxed as an instructional exercise in June 1978. Sheet G fragments were found with other miscellaneous fragments in Oct 1981.' Two fragments written with black ink with demotic mathematical text on recto and verso, parts of several columns concerned with arithmetical problems. This is part of the same manuscript as EA 10399. Several fragments appear to have been removed; '10399' is written in several places on the glass in yellow crayon.
Curator's comments: Part of EA 10399? EA 10399 is to be published by A. Imhausen. The papyrus was published by Parker, Demotic Mathematical Papyri (London, 1972), but since then two new fragments have been identified by Carol Andrews from a made-up roll (initially registered as EA 10981) and since rejoined to EA 10399.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (55977) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/55977)
